text:
- [Stephen] Customers tell
us they want easier ways

to learn and engage with
AWS end user computing
EUC experts more directly.

Over the past few years,
the number of services

and features in AWS EUC
has more than doubled.
With more offerings, more partners,
and more ways to solve your desktop
and application streaming challenges,
it's important to stay up to date.
My name is Stephen K. Stetler

and I am the worldwide technical
leader for end user compute

covering the Amazon
Workspaces family of services.

In this video, I want to introduce
you to our new community.
Historically, we've kept you informed

with what's new updates
and our AWS desktop
and application streaming blog site.

And recently we launched
this very easy playlist

you're watching right now
on the AWS YouTube channel.

We will continue to
leverage these avenues.

However, we want to
take it a step further.
We want to engage directly with you,

our AWS EUC community and answer
your most common questions.

That's why we're actively
building knowledge
and how to articles on community.aws.

And we're tagging all
those articles with EUC
to make them easy for you to find.
Community.aws isn't just a platform,
it's a place where we can move fast.

We can engage directly
with you in the comments,

update articles with new
releases or corrections,
and share fresh ideas quickly.
And it's not just us.

Community.aws allows you,
customers, EUC admins,

partners, builders to
create your own articles,

share your insights, and
join the conversation.

We want to hear how you're
using AWS EUC services.
We need to know what's working for you,
what features connect with your workflows,

and what ideas you have
to improve our services.
And this is only just the beginning.
Your engagement on community.aws
will lead to even more opportunities

like participation in
future community events.
So if you haven't already,

create your AWS builder
ID and join us today.
Let's keep the conversation going.

Jump into the comments
and share your thoughts.

Or better yet, create your own
article and tag it with EUC.

Thanks for watching and we'll
see you in the community.
